title: Senior Tories' report on scrapping backstop 'ignored' Northern Irish business concerns
text:
A pro-Brexit think tank has been accused of ignoring criticism from Northern Irish businesses over plans for a replacement to the controversial backstop mechanism when Britain leaves the European Union.

Prosperity UK issued a report claiming that the backstop – which could tie Britain into EU rules indefinitely and is politically toxic – could be replaced with existing customs and regulatory measures which would keep the border open.

The proposals included a trusted trader scheme for businesses, a light touch approach to customs aided by technology, and moving checks on goods away from the border.
